title: A Newspaper Founder's Life and Legacy
summary: Sir Andreas Whittam Smith, who helped start The Independent newspaper, has passed away at age 88. His family shared the news. He was a journalist who worked at big newspapers like the Financial Times and The Daily Telegraph before creating The Independent in 1986 with friends. This newspaper was special because it did not always support one political party. People called him a pioneer for changing British journalism. He also had important jobs like helping the Church of England with its money and rating movies. He was knighted for his work. He leaves behind his wife, children, and grandchildren.

background_read: Sir Andreas Whittam Smith was a British journalist known for creating The Independent, a newspaper that aimed to be fair and not side with any political party. He worked at other newspapers before this and was respected for his work in journalism and public service, including roles with the Church of England and film classification.
